H0.text: when did the us stop drafting for the vietnam war. 1968

H2.text: when did the us stop drafting for the vietnam war. 1970

H3.text: when did the us stop drafting for the vietnam war. 1973

A4.text: On 27 January 1973, Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird announced the creation of an all-volunteer armed forces, negating the need for the military draft.

A5.text: The seventh and final lottery drawing was held on 12 March 1975, pertaining to men born in 1956, who would have been called to report for induction in 1976.

A6.text: Conscription existed since World War II, but ended in 1973.
